DataElement.preferredName: Pulmonary Function Test Hemoglobin Corrected Diffusion Capacity of the Lung for Carbon Monoxide Measurement Integer::2 Decimal Place Liter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 2 decimal place numeric liter value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of the hemoglobin corrected carbon monoxide diffusion capacity measurement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pulmonary Function Test Hemoglobin Corrected Diffusion Capacity of the Lung for Carbon Monoxide Measurement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A broad range of tests that are performed to assess how well lungs inhale and exhale air and how efficiently they transfer oxygen into the blood._An assessment of the diffusion capacity of the lungs for carbon monoxide adjusted for hemoglobin concentration._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Pulmonary Function Test Hemoglobin Corrected Diffusion Capacity of the Lung for Carbon Monoxide
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A broad range of tests that are performed to assess how well lungs inhale and exhale air and how efficiently they transfer oxygen into the blood.:An assessment of the diffusion capacity of the lungs for carbon monoxide adjusted for hemoglobin concentration.

Concepts.definition: A broad range of tests that are performed to assess how well lungs inhale and exhale air and how efficiently they transfer oxygen into the blood.

Concepts.longName: Hemoglobin Corrected Diffusion Capacity of the Lung for Carbon Monoxide
Concepts.definition: An assessment of the diffusion capacity of the lungs for carbon monoxide adjusted for hemoglobin concentration.

Property.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Pulmonary Function Test Integer::2 Decimal Place Liter Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A broad range of tests that are performed to assess how well lungs inhale and exhale air and how efficiently they transfer oxygen into the blood._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._The non-SI unit of volume accepted for use with the SI. One liter is equal to cubic decimeter, or one thousandth of cubic meter, or 1000 cubic centimeters, or approximately 61.023 744 cubic inches._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Pulmonary Function Test Integer::2 Decimal Place Liter Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A broad range of tests that are performed to assess how well lungs inhale and exhale air and how efficiently they transfer oxygen into the blood.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::2:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:The non-SI unit of volume accepted for use with the SI. One liter is equal to cubic decimeter, or one thousandth of cubic meter, or 1000 cubic centimeters, or approximately 61.023 744 cubic inches.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A broad range of tests that are performed to assess how well lungs inhale and exhale air and how efficiently they transfer oxygen into the blood.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
The non-SI unit of volume accepted for use with the SI. One liter is equal to cubic decimeter, or one thousandth of cubic meter, or 1000 cubic centimeters, or approximately 61.023 744 cubic inches.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
